intro: Hieracium vlasitschense, commonly known as the Vlasitschenskai hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and is typically found in alpine and subalpine regions of Central Europe. The plant produces yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in a composite head, which are borne on long, slender stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Hieracium vlasitschense is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats at higher elevations.
